channel.title: Comments on: Vote for Your Favorite Kuri Beer Accessory!
channel.description: Meet Kuri, the adorable home robot.

item.title: By: Focused
item.dc:creator: Focused
item.description: I'm a little (haha) behind with "non-critical" emails, but this brought a huge smile to my face 2 weeks after the fact... at first I was pleasantly baffled that our bright Engineers would come up with these 3 gadgets as viable options. But what a perfect ending to the response chain, I truly hope the Team can implement some useful services for the disabled. Patiently waiting the next delivery cycle, June 27 is my birthday;)
item.content:encoded: I’m a little (haha) behind with “non-critical” emails, but this brought a huge smile to my face 2 weeks after the fact… at first I was pleasantly baffled that our bright Engineers would come up with these 3 gadgets as viable options. But what a perfect ending to the response chain, I truly hope the Team can implement some useful services for the disabled. Patiently waiting the next delivery cycle, June 27 is my birthday;)

item.title: By: Jim
item.dc:creator: Jim
item.description: That is a great idea. It's comments/suggestions/ideas like this that spark the brainstorming for what is possible. I look forward for what the future holds for Kuri.
item.content:encoded: That is a great idea. It’s comments/suggestions/ideas like this that spark the brainstorming for what is possible. I look forward for what the future holds for Kuri.

item.title: By: Jennifer
item.dc:creator: Jennifer
item.description: Bingo! We hope you all got a kick out of our April Fool's Day prank. ;)
item.content:encoded: Bingo! We hope you all got a kick out of our April Fool’s Day prank. 😉

item.title: By: Leslie Brown
item.dc:creator: Leslie Brown
item.description: I agree with you 100%! I am disabled. While I love the idea of having Kuri in my home as a companion and possible watch dog-recording things that I won’t see that might go on in my house, it would be nice if he did have some extended functionality in the future. Even though being adorable is awesome, the companion side of it. I think it would be an extra bonus if he were able to deliver small items like medicines or a beverage that would be nice. Sometimes, I drop small objects like toothpaste caps or coins or pills on the carpet and have difficulty locating them again. If Kuri could have some kind of “find it“ feature where you could ask him how close you are to the object in the floor with your hand or even with his body by making a rising or falling Tone as he or your hand which( ever would be easier to implement) gets nearer to the object, that would be an interesting feature. Probably programmatically impossible, but an interesting feature.
item.content:encoded: I agree with you 100%! I am disabled. While I love the idea of having Kuri in my home as a companion and possible watch dog-recording things that I won’t see that might go on in my house, it would be nice if he did have some extended functionality in the future. Even though being adorable is awesome, the companion side of it. I think it would be an extra bonus if he were able to deliver small items like medicines or a beverage that would be nice. Sometimes, I drop small objects like toothpaste caps or coins or pills on the carpet and have difficulty locating them again. If Kuri could have some kind of “find it“ feature where you could ask him how close you are to the object in the floor with your hand or even with his body by making a rising or falling Tone as he or your hand which( ever would be easier to implement) gets nearer to the object, that would be an interesting feature. Probably programmatically impossible, but an interesting feature.

item.title: By: Richie
item.dc:creator: Richie
item.description: I should add, not everyone has children in the home and so not needing a child companion, we're looking for other useful features from Kuri to justify a useful existence for the purchase price. Example: Kuri could be a great assistant to the sick, disabled, or elderly with the right features in the future.
item.content:encoded: I should add, not everyone has children in the home and so not needing a child companion, we’re looking for other useful features from Kuri to justify a useful existence for the purchase price. Example: Kuri could be a great assistant to the sick, disabled, or elderly with the right features in the future.

item.title: By: Richie
item.dc:creator: Richie
item.description: Good idea to be able to carry/deliver something to someone in the house. Kuri with expanded uses makes it that much more valuable. Nice if someone is sick, have to deliver a bottle of orange juice or something else to someone laying on the sofa.
item.content:encoded: Good idea to be able to carry/deliver something to someone in the house. Kuri with expanded uses makes it that much more valuable. Nice if someone is sick, have to deliver a bottle of orange juice or something else to someone laying on the sofa.

item.title: By: Richie
item.dc:creator: Richie
item.description: Doesn't HAVE to carry beer. Would work for soda or Bai flavored water.
item.content:encoded: Doesn’t HAVE to carry beer. Would work for soda or Bai flavored water.

item.title: By: Jennifer
item.dc:creator: Jennifer
item.description: Hi Paul, the second wave of pre-orders are shipping between June 15th and July 30th. If you order today, you'll receive your Kuri later this summer (no firm shipping dates just yet!).
item.content:encoded: Hi Paul, the second wave of pre-orders are shipping between June 15th and July 30th. If you order today, you’ll receive your Kuri later this summer (no firm shipping dates just yet!).
